snippet: Human rights groups say the law, approved by the lower house of Parliament, could be used to intimidate government critics and impede efforts to promote democracy.
abstract: Russian lawmakers, in another clampdown of dissent, approve bill that would impose tougher registration and reporting requirements on nongovernmental organizations that receive financing from foreign governments or other donors abroad; human rights groups say law, which is expected to receive final approval, could be used to intimidate government critics and to impede progress toward democracy.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW ROTH

lead_paragraph: Human rights groups say the law, approved by the lower house of Parliament, could be used to intimidate government critics and impede efforts to promote democracy.

headline.seo: Tough Bill on Nonprofits Advances in Russia
headline.main: Russian Law Would Place Tougher Restrictions on Nonprofits
headline.print_headline: Tough Bill on Nonprofits Advances in Russia
